thread.title: White House says U.S.-Mexico relationship 'is phenomenal'
thread.title_full: White House says U.S.-Mexico relationship 'is phenomenal'

author: CAMERON JOSEPH
title: White House says U.S.-Mexico relationship 'is phenomenal'
text:
NEW YORK DAILY NEWS  11 PM 
WASHINGTON — Top Trump administration officials are on their way to Mexico to talk through their controversial new deportation guidelines , as the White House claimed in spite of evidence to the contrary that everything "is phenomenal" between the countries. 
Secretary of State Rex Tillerson and Department of Homeland Security Secretary John Kelly are on their way to meet with top Mexican officials and discuss the DHS's news order to dramatically ramp up deportations of undocumented immigrants — and try to mend fences after months of building tensions between the countries. U.S. Secretary of State Rex Tillerson (c.) exits his limousine prior to his departure for Mexico. (CARLOS BARRIA/REUTERS) 
Mexican officials are furious about the move, especially the orders that suggest deporting all immigrants who cross the Mexican border back to Mexico even if they're from other countries — the latest flare-up driven by President Trump's repeated promise to build a wall along the entire border and somehow force Mexico to pay for its construction, his promise to force a renegotiation of the North American Free Trade Agreement, and his regularly harsh rhetoric towards Mexican immigrants. 
In spite of the tensions surrounding the trip, the White House claimed that everything is hunky-dory between the neighboring countries.
